pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:0.5: 56. The training rule on monasteries without monks
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.2: At that time a number of nuns who had completed the rainy-season residence in a village monastery went to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.4: “Venerables, where did you spend the rains residence?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.5: We hope the instruction was effective?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.7: So how could the instruction be effective?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.8: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.9: “How could nuns spend the rains residence in a monastery without monks?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.15: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:1.16.1: ‘If a nun spends the rainy-season residence in a monastery without monks, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.6: she is not able to go to the instruction or to formal meetings of the community.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.7: If she thinks, “I’ll stay here for the rainy-season residence,” and she prepares a dwelling, sets out water for drinking and water for washing, and sweeps the yard, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.1.8: At dawn, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.2: if the monks who entered the rainy-season residence there depart or disrobe or die or join another faction;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc56:2.2.6: The sixth training rule is finished.
